About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

BIO

My name is Alan Campbell and this is my website. I recently completed a Higher Diploma in Science (Software Development) with first class honours from Maynooth University in 2018. I also hold a first class honours Masters Degree in Geographical Information Systems & Remote Sensing and a Double Honours Bachelors Degree in Geography and History from Maynooth University.

Data Analyst

All-Island Research Observatory (AIRO)

I worked as a Data Analyst for over three years with the All-Island Research Observatory (AIRO). AIRO undertakes academic and applied mapping research and produces spatial datasets and specialist tools. I was primarily involved in content creation for the AIRO website including Mapping Modules and Interactive Graphs, assisting in the creation of maps detailing CSO Census and non-Census data for inclusion in various reports and teaching the AIRO 'Data for Decisions' workshops.

Lifeguard & Swimming Teacher

Clondalkin Leisure Centre

During my Undergraduate and Masters degrees I worked part-time as a Pool Lifeguard and Swimming Teacher at Clondalkin Leisure Centre. My roles included supervision of the swimming pool with a team of lifeguards during public hours, teaching swimming lessons to class sizes of up to 15 children, carrying out risk assessment duties and cleaning of the pool bank.

University Tutor

Department of Geography, Maynooth University

During my Masters Degree, I worked as a University Tutor for the Department of Geography at Maynooth University. I taught two classes of fifteen first year Geography students on a fortnightly basis. My responsibilities included preparing for the tutorial in advance of the class, teaching the class, providing guidance and advice on understanding key concepts and correcting regularly submitted work whilst providing feedback.
